channel.title: ~~Error~~
channel.description:
:mad: :eek: :| PROBLEM :| :eek: :mad:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: server press any key to continue_
Some one have any tips on this one?
Ok once this problems is solved I think I'll hopefully have a server up and running.
Cheers, Hmpph

item.title: ~~Error~~
item.dc:creator: @hmpph hmpph
item.description:
@hmpph wrote:

Heya I just had a power cut sorry bout not responding for a while.
My main folder is in “my documents” whcih contains everything.
my jdk is in its own folder in there though also my win.rar is in its own folder too.
All my moparscape related files are together in one folder, spread into seperate folders i.e all the .class files are in one and all the .java in another.

I moved my compiler and runserver from a different file into that same folder, I don’t know if thats the problem or not, but yeah.
Hope this helps?[br][size=1]Posted on: January 02, 2007, 06:15:33 PM[/size][hr]Also sorry paulT about asking this question I have just found under the “Do not ask” section.
My bad sorry.

Read full topic

item.title: ~~Error~~
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Either you don’t have java set up/installed correctly or your main class does not exist in the directory you are running from/pointing to.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

What folder is your “server.class” file in, what folder is the batch file you opened to get that error in, and what are the contents of that batch file
